questions.question: What does 'A stitch in time saves nine' mean?
questions.answer: Acting early prevents bigger problems
questions.explanation: If you fix a small tear (one stitch) immediately, you won't need nine stitches later. Taking early action prevents bigger problems.

questions.question: What does 'Where there is a will, there is a way' mean?
questions.answer: Hard work leads to success
questions.explanation: If you have determination (will), you will find a method (way) to succeed. Determination and hard work lead to success.

questions.question: What does 'Honesty is the best policy' mean?
questions.answer: Truthfulness is always rewarded
questions.explanation: Being honest is the best approach in life. Truth always wins in the end.

questions.question: What does 'Practice makes perfect' mean?
questions.answer: Practice makes a person perfect
questions.explanation: Repeated practice of any skill leads to mastery and perfection.

questions.question: What does 'Don't count your chickens before they hatch' mean?
options: Don't be overconfident about something that hasn't happened yet
questions.answer: Don't be overconfident about something that hasn't happened yet
questions.explanation: Don't assume success before it actually happens. Wait for results before celebrating.

questions.question: What does 'Actions speak louder than words' mean?
options: What you do matters more than what you say
questions.answer: What you do matters more than what you say
questions.explanation: Your actions demonstrate your true intentions more than your words. Doing is more important than just saying.

questions.question: What does 'The early bird catches the worm' mean?
options: Those who act early have an advantage
questions.answer: Those who act early have an advantage
questions.explanation: People who start early or act promptly have the best chance of success.

questions.question: What does 'Don't judge a book by its cover' mean?
options: Don't judge things or people by their appearance
questions.answer: Don't judge things or people by their appearance
questions.explanation: You shouldn't form opinions based only on outward appearance. Look deeper to understand true value.

questions.question: What does 'Too many cooks spoil the broth' mean?
options: Too many people involved in a task can ruin it
questions.answer: Too many people involved in a task can ruin it
questions.explanation: When too many people try to manage something, they end up making it worse. Too much interference is harmful.

questions.question: What does 'Rome wasn't built in a day' mean?
options: Great things take time to accomplish
questions.answer: Great things take time to accomplish
questions.explanation: Important achievements require time and patience. Don't expect instant results for big goals.

questions.question: What does 'When in Rome, do as the Romans do' mean?
options: Adapt to local customs and behavior
questions.answer: Adapt to local customs and behavior
questions.explanation: When you're in a new place or situation, follow the local customs and adapt to your surroundings.

questions.question: What does 'A penny saved is a penny earned' mean?
options: Saving money is as important as earning it
questions.answer: Saving money is as important as earning it
questions.explanation: Money that you save is just as valuable as money you earn. Being frugal is wise.

questions.question: What does 'Better late than never' mean?
options: It's better to do something late than not do it at all
questions.answer: It's better to do something late than not do it at all
questions.explanation: It's preferable to complete something behind schedule than to not complete it at all.

questions.question: What does 'Look before you leap' mean?
questions.answer: Think carefully before acting
questions.explanation: Consider the consequences before taking action. Don't act rashly without thinking.

questions.question: What does 'Necessity is the mother of invention' mean?
options: Need drives people to create solutions
questions.answer: Need drives people to create solutions
questions.explanation: When people need something, they find creative ways to get or make it. Necessity inspires innovation.

questions.question: What does 'All that glitters is not gold' mean?
options: Not everything that looks valuable is actually valuable
questions.answer: Not everything that looks valuable is actually valuable
questions.explanation: Things that appear attractive or valuable on the surface may not be genuine. Appearances can be deceptive.

questions.question: What does 'Birds of a feather flock together' mean?
options: People with similar interests tend to spend time together
questions.answer: People with similar interests tend to spend time together
questions.explanation: People who are alike tend to associate with each other. Like-minded people group together.

questions.question: What does 'Every cloud has a silver lining' mean?
options: There is something good in every bad situation
questions.answer: There is something good in every bad situation
questions.explanation: Even in difficult times, there is always some hope or positive aspect. Bad situations can have good outcomes.

questions.question: What does 'Two wrongs don't make a right' mean?
options: Responding to wrongdoing with wrongdoing is not justified
questions.answer: Responding to wrongdoing with wrongdoing is not justified
questions.explanation: You cannot justify doing something wrong just because someone else did something wrong to you.

questions.question: What does 'An apple a day keeps the doctor away' mean?
questions.answer: Healthy habits prevent illness
questions.explanation: Taking care of your health through good habits (like eating fruit) helps you stay healthy and avoid getting sick.
